questions.question: ………………………… they live here?
questions.description: Have is followed by the past participle are is followed by an ing form do is followed by the infinitive without to.

questions.question: ………………………… the door when you leave.
questions.description: The simple present is used in imperatives.

questions.question: I would rather you …………………………… talking to him.
questions.description: A simple past is used after would rather to refer to the present or future.

questions.question: He asked if we ……………………………. our food.
questions.description: Present perfect becomes past perfect in the reported speech.

questions.question: Neither of these answers ………………………………. right.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after neither or either.

questions.question: Marconi ………………………….. the radio.
questions.description: Use the simple past to simply say that something happened.

questions.question: He is used to …………………………… hard.
questions.description: The to in used to is a preposition. Use an ing form after a preposition.

questions.question: Iron …………………………… in many countries.
questions.description: Is found is the passive form of find.

questions.question: While he was walking across the field, he ……………………………. by a snake.
questions.description: Was bitten is the passive form of bite.
